questions.text: Before starting your engine, which of the following should be properly adjusted?
options: The vehicle's climate control and entertainment systems
Your seat, all mirrors, and the steering column
The fuel mixture and tire pressure monitoring system
The trip odometer and clock

questions.text: Florida law requires that your vehicle's windshield:
options: May have a non-reflective tint on the top 6 inches
Must be made of safety glass and be free of any stickers or obstructions
Can have cracks shorter than 3 inches without requiring repair
Must be replaced if it has any minor pitting or sand scratches

questions.text: Bumper height requirements in Florida are determined primarily by:
options: The vehicle's make and model year
A fixed measurement that is identical for all passenger vehicles
The net weight of the vehicle
The manufacturer's original specifications only

questions.text: If you are hauling a load of loose gravel that could spill onto the roadway, you are required by law to:
options: Display a 'Wide Load' sign on the back of your vehicle
Use a close-fitting cover sufficient to prevent any contents from falling or blowing out
Drive only on designated truck routes and avoid highways
Flash your hazard lights continuously while moving

questions.text: During daylight hours, a load extending four feet or more beyond the rear of a vehicle must be marked with:
options: A 12-inch solid red flag
A 16-inch solid red or orange flag
A white flag and an amber strobe light
Reflective silver tape on the furthest point

questions.text: The primary danger of drowsy driving is that it:
options: Is only a problem on long, monotonous interstate trips
Significantly impairs your reaction time, judgment, and awareness
Will cause you to receive a ticket if observed by law enforcement
Makes it illegal to drive between the hours of 2 AM and 6 AM

questions.text: If another driver is driving aggressively and threatening you, the safest course of action is to:
options: Make eye contact and gesture to communicate your displeasure
Speed up to create a larger gap between you and them
Avoid making eye contact, stay calm, and safely move out of their way
Pull over and confront the driver to defuse the situation

questions.text: The three recognized types of distraction that can affect a driver are:
options: Auditory, Sensory, and Psychological
Visual, Manual, and Cognitive
Internal, External, and Emotional
Physical, Mental, and Environmental

questions.text: Texting while driving is considered particularly dangerous because it:
options: Is the only distraction that is illegal in all 50 states
Involves all three types of distraction (visual, manual, and cognitive) simultaneously
Causes drivers to slow down and impede the normal flow of traffic
Is a distraction that only new drivers struggle with

questions.text: Regarding the ability to drive safely after drinking alcohol:
options: Most people can drive safely after one or two drinks
Only individuals under the age of 21 are unable to do so safely
No one can drink and drive safely, as alcohol affects all drivers
It is safe if you have eaten a large meal beforehand

questions.text: After consuming alcohol, the first ability you lose is:
options: Your night vision and depth perception
Your physical coordination and balance
Your judgment and ability to make sound decisions
Your hearing and sense of smell

questions.text: In a collision, an unbelted occupant is most likely to:
options: Be protected by the vehicle's advanced crumple zones
Be thrown against the interior of the car or ejected from it, leading to severe injury or death
Experience only minor bruises, as the force is absorbed by the airbags
Be safer than a belted occupant in a rollover crash

questions.text: Florida's child restraint law requires children to be in a federally approved car seat until they are:
options: 3 years of age
4 years of age
5 years of age
6 years of age

questions.text: If a front-seat passenger under the age of 18 is stopped and found not to be wearing a seat belt, who will be charged with the violation?
options: The passenger themselves, as they are responsible for their own safety
The driver of the vehicle
Both the driver and the passenger will be charged
The registered owner of the vehicle, regardless of who is driving

questions.text: On a roadway, a single broken white line between lanes means:
options: You are in a mandatory carpool lane during peak hours
Lane changes are discouraged and may be unsafe
You may change lanes if it is safe to do so
The lane is ending, and you must merge

questions.text: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-lane road means:
options: Passing is allowed for both directions if done quickly
Passing is prohibited for vehicles traveling in both directions
Passing is allowed only for vehicles turning left into a driveway
It marks a reversible lane, and passing depends on the time of day

questions.text: A solid yellow line to the right of the centerline indicates that:
options: Passing is permitted for traffic moving in your direction
You are on a one-way road with opposing traffic to your right
Passing is prohibited for traffic in your lane
The road is splitting into two separate roadways ahead

questions.text: The color red on a traffic sign is universally used to convey:
options: General warning and caution ahead
Stop, yield, or a prohibition (e.g., Do Not Enter)
Motorist services and guidance information
Construction and maintenance activities

questions.text: At an intersection with four stop signs (a 4-way stop), the right-of-way is granted to:
options: The largest vehicle, regardless of arrival time
The first vehicle to come to a complete stop at the intersection
The vehicle on the through street, if one exists
All vehicles simultaneously, requiring careful negotiation

questions.text:
A steady red traffic light means you must:
A flashing red traffic light means you must:
options: Stop, then proceed with caution; Stop, then proceed only if the intersection is clear
Slow down and prepare to stop; Stop completely until the light turns green
Stop and wait for a green light; Treat it as a yield sign
Stop, then turn right if clear; Come to a complete stop, yield, and proceed when safe

questions.text: You may make a right turn at a steady red light:
options: Never; it is illegal in all circumstances
After coming to a complete stop and yielding to all cross traffic and pedestrians
Only if there is a dedicated right-turn lane with a yield sign
Only between the hours of 9 PM and 5 AM when traffic is light

questions.text: A green arrow displayed at the same time as a red light means:
options: All traffic must stop, including those turning in the direction of the arrow
You may carefully proceed in the direction of the arrow after yielding
You have a protected turn; you may turn in the direction of the arrow without yielding to other traffic
The arrow is about to turn yellow, and you should prepare to stop

questions.text: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection instructs you to:
options: Stop completely before proceeding with caution
Slow down and proceed through the intersection with caution
Come to a complete stop if you can do so safely
Speed up to clear the intersection before the light changes

questions.text: When approaching a railroad crossing that has no gates or flashing lights, and you see a train approaching, you must:
options: Cross the tracks quickly before the train arrives
Slow down, check both ways, and proceed if you think you can beat the train
Stop at least 15 feet from the nearest rail and wait until the train has passed
Sound your horn and flash your headlights to warn the train engineer

questions.text: If you double your speed from 20 mph to 40 mph, the force of impact in a crash will be:
options: Doubled
Tripled
Quadrupled
Increased by a factor of eight

questions.text: Unless otherwise posted, the standard speed limit in a residential area is:
options: 20 mph
25 mph
30 mph
35 mph

questions.text: The maximum speed limit on a limited access Florida highway is:
options: 65 mph
70 mph
75 mph
80 mph

questions.text: Can you be issued a traffic citation for driving too slowly?
options: No, it is always safer to drive below the speed limit
Yes, if you are driving so slowly that you block or impede the normal flow of traffic
Only if you are driving more than 15 mph under the limit on a highway
Only if you are driving a commercial vehicle like a large truck

questions.text: For a smooth, controlled stop, you should:
options: Press the brake pedal firmly and consistently until you stop
Pump the brakes rapidly to alert drivers behind you
Take your foot off the accelerator, then press the brake pedal gradually
Shift into neutral first to save brake wear, then apply the brakes

questions.text: The correct hand and arm signal for indicating a left turn is:
options: Hand and arm extended straight out
Hand and arm extended upward
Hand and arm extended downward
Circling your hand and arm in a counter-clockwise motion

questions.text: You must begin to signal for a turn continuously for at least the last ____ before you turn.
options: 50 feet
100 feet
150 feet
200 feet

questions.text: A three-point turn (K-turn) is illegal and should never be attempted:
options: On any road with a speed limit above 35 mph
On a curve or hill where visibility is less than 500 feet in both directions
In a residential neighborhood, even if no traffic is present
In any business district during hours of darkness

questions.text: An 'open intersection' is one where:
options: There are no traffic control signs or signals at the intersection
The intersection has a green light and is clear of all traffic
It is located in a rural area with very little traffic
The intersection has a yield sign instead of a stop sign

questions.text: On a four-lane road with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may use the left lane:
options: As a through lane for normal driving at any time
Only when you are passing another vehicle or preparing to make a left turn
Only if you are traveling at the maximum posted speed limit
Never; the left lane is reserved for emergency vehicles only

questions.text: If you see red reflectors on the lane lines facing you, this means:
options: You are traveling the wrong way on a one-way road or ramp; you should pull over immediately
You are entering a toll road and must prepare to pay
The lane is reserved for emergency vehicles during peak hours
There is road construction ahead; reduce speed and proceed with caution

questions.text: The recommended minimum safe following distance under ideal driving conditions is:
options: 1 second
2 seconds
3 to 4 seconds
5 to 6 seconds

questions.text: You should increase your following distance beyond the recommended minimum when:
options: You are being tailgated by another driver
The pavement is dry and visibility is perfect
You are on a multi-lane interstate highway
You are following a passenger car that is below the speed limit

questions.text: A 'blind spot' is best defined as:
options: An area behind your vehicle that is hidden by the trunk or rear window
Any area around your vehicle that is not visible in your mirrors
The area directly in front of your vehicle that is blocked by the hood
The area to the sides of your vehicle that is hidden by the door frames

questions.text: The most effective way to check your blind spots before changing lanes is to:
options: Rely on your rearview and side mirrors, as they are designed to eliminate blind spots
Quickly turn your head and glance over your shoulder in the direction you intend to move
Use your peripheral vision while keeping your eyes focused straight ahead
Activate your turn signal and wait to see if other drivers honk in protest

questions.text: It is unlawful and dangerous to attempt to pass another vehicle:
options: On any two-lane road, regardless of markings
When you are in a designated passing zone with a dashed yellow line
On a hill, curve, or anywhere your view is obstructed
When you are traveling at the posted speed limit

questions.text: On an expressway, the acceleration lane should:
options: Be used as a stopping area to wait for a large gap in traffic
Never be used to stop your vehicle for any reason
Be used to stop and check your GPS for directions
Be used to stop if you realize you are entering the wrong highway

questions.text: If you realize you have missed your intended exit on a limited access highway, you should:
options: Stop and back up along the shoulder until you reach the exit
Make a U-turn across the median if there is no barrier
Proceed to the next exit; never stop or back up on a highway
Use the emergency crossovers if available to reverse direction

questions.text: If your vehicle becomes disabled on a highway, your first priority should be to:
options: Exit the vehicle and attempt to push it to safety
Get the vehicle off the roadway and onto the shoulder, if possible
Stay in your vehicle with your seatbelt on and wait for help
Place flares directly behind the vehicle to warn others

questions.text: When parallel parking, your vehicle's wheels must be no more than ____ from the curb.
options: 6 inches
12 inches
18 inches
24 inches

questions.text: When parking facing downhill on a street with a curb, the driver of a vehicle with a manual transmission should leave the car in:
options: Neutral with the parking brake firmly engaged
First gear with the parking brake disengaged
Reverse gear with the parking brake firmly engaged
Any gear is acceptable as long as the parking brake is set

questions.text: In which of the following locations is parking always illegal?
options: On the paved shoulder of a controlled-access highway
Within 15 feet of a fire hydrant
In a private driveway with the owner's verbal permission
On a one-way street in the direction of traffic flow

questions.text: When parking your vehicle facing uphill against a curb, you should turn your front wheels:
options: Away from the curb, towards the center of the road
Towards the curb
Straight ahead, parallel to the curb
It does not matter; the parking brake will hold the car

questions.text: Florida law requires motorists to:
options: Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians only within marked crosswalks
Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians crossing the roadway at any marked or unmarked crosswalk
Honk to alert pedestrians when they are in the roadway
Stop for pedestrians only when a crossing guard is present

questions.text: When you see a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog in the street ahead, you must:
options: Proceed with caution, as they will yield to you
Come to a complete stop and yield the right-of-way
Change lanes to give them a wider berth if possible
Flash your headlights to warn them of your approach

questions.text: Florida law requires that motorists maintain a minimum clearance of ____ when passing a bicyclist.
options: 2 feet
3 feet
4 feet
5 feet

questions.text: Before making a right turn across a bicycle lane, a motorist must:
options: Merge into the bicycle lane approximately 200 feet before the turn
Stop in the bicycle lane and wait for a gap in bicycle traffic
Yield to any bicyclists in the lane, merge into the lane only when safe, and then execute the turn
Honk to warn bicyclists and then turn quickly ahead of them

questions.text: Motorcyclists and moped riders on the roadway:
options: Have fewer rights than drivers of passenger vehicles
Have the same rights and responsibilities as other motor vehicle drivers
Are required to use sidewalks and bike paths when available
Must always ride in a single file line, even in a designated lane

questions.text: A motorist is allowed to share a single traffic lane with a motorcycle:
options: Whenever the lane is wide enough to do so safely
Only if the motorcyclist signals that it is permissible
No; motorcycles are entitled to the full use of a lane
Only on multi-lane highways outside of urban areas

questions.text: On a highway divided by a raised concrete barrier, when a school bus is stopped with red lights flashing on the opposite side:
options: Traffic traveling in the opposite direction must also come to a stop
Traffic traveling in the opposite direction is not required to stop
Traffic must stop only if children are visibly crossing the road
Traffic must stop only if there is no barrier present

questions.text: When a school bus stops and displays its red flashing lights and stop arm on your side of an undivided roadway:
options: You may proceed with caution at a speed under 10 mph
You must stop until the lights are turned off and the bus begins moving
You must stop only if you are directly behind the bus
You must stop only during official school hours

questions.text: You must stop for a school bus:
options: Whenever its yellow hazard lights are flashing
Only when you are on a two-lane road
When it is displaying red flashing lights and has its stop arm extended, on any road without a physical median
Only if you see children actively getting on or off the bus

questions.text: When a school crossing guard is present in a crosswalk and signaling you to stop, you must:
options: Slow down to 5 mph and proceed if no children are present
Stop and remain stopped until the guard signals you to proceed
Make eye contact with the guard and proceed if they wave you on
Stop only if the crosswalk is located within a school zone

questions.text: If an emergency vehicle ( ambulance, fire truck, police car) is approaching you from any direction with its lights and sirens active, you must:
options: Speed up to get out of its way as quickly as possible
Pull over to the closest edge or curb of the roadway and stop
Stop immediately right where you are, even if you are in an intersection
Flash your headlights to acknowledge that you see the emergency vehicle

questions.text: Florida's Move Over Law requires drivers to:
options: Move into the farthest lane from any stopped emergency or service vehicle, or slow down to 20 mph below the posted limit
Stop completely behind any stopped emergency vehicle
Honk their horn to alert workers of their presence
Only move over on interstate highways, not on surface streets

questions.text: The 'No-Zone' refers to:
options: Areas in a construction zone where stopping is prohibited
The blind spots around large commercial trucks where the car is invisible to the truck driver
A designated no-passing zone marked by double yellow lines
The area directly in front of a school bus when its lights are flashing

questions.text: You are required to turn on your headlights:
options: Only between sunset and sunrise
From sunset to sunrise, during rain, smoke, or fog, and when visibility is less than 1000 feet
Only when you cannot see the road ahead clearly for at least 500 feet
Whenever you are using your windshield wipers for any reason

questions.text: You must dim your high-beam headlights to low beams when you are within ____ of following another vehicle.
options: 200 feet
300 feet
400 feet
500 feet

questions.text: You must dim your high-beam headlights to low beams when you are within ____ of an oncoming vehicle.
options: 300 feet
500 feet
700 feet
1000 feet

questions.text: During daytime rain, fog, or smoke, you should use:
options: Your high-beam headlights to maximize visibility
Your low-beam headlights to help other drivers see you
Your parking lights only, as they are less glaring
Your hazard lights to indicate dangerous conditions

questions.text: The best practice for driving on wet roads in the rain is to reduce your speed because:
options: It is required by law whenever your windshield wipers are on
It helps prevent hydroplaning by maintaining tire contact with the road
It allows your engine to run more efficiently in damp conditions
It makes it easier to see the roadway through a wet windshield

questions.text: If your vehicle's right wheels unintentionally drift off onto the shoulder of the pavement, you should:
options: Brake hard to slow down before pulling back on the road
Grip the steering wheel firmly, ease off the accelerator, and steer back onto the road when safe
Jerking the steering wheel quickly to the left to get back on the pavement immediately
Accelerate slightly to gain control and then steer back onto the road

questions.text: If your vehicle begins to skid, your initial reaction should be to:
options: Pump your brakes rhythmically if you have anti-lock brakes (ABS)
Steer hard in the opposite direction of the skid
Take your foot off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want the front of the car to go
Accelerate gently to regain traction and straighten the vehicle

questions.text: In a vehicle equipped with Anti-lock Brakes (ABS), the correct method for emergency braking is to:
options: Pump the brake pedal rapidly and repeatedly
Apply firm, steady pressure to the brake pedal and hold it while steering
Apply light pressure to the brake pedal and gradually increase pressure
Use the parking brake first, then apply the foot brake

questions.text: If you experience a sudden tire blowout while driving, you should:
options: Slam on the brakes to stop as quickly as possible
Grip the steering wheel tightly, take your foot off the gas, and let the car slow down before gently steering to a safe stop
Accelerate briefly to regain control, then brake hard
Immediately steer sharply towards the shoulder of the road

questions.text: If you are involved in a minor crash and your vehicle is blocking traffic, you should:
options: Leave the vehicles in place exactly as they came to rest for police investigation
Move your vehicle out of the travel lanes to a safe nearby location if it is drivable and safe to do so
Stand behind your vehicle to direct traffic around the scene
Immediately exit your vehicle and run to a safe location away from the road

questions.text: If you hit a parked vehicle and cannot find the owner, you must:
options: Wait for at least 30 minutes for the owner to return
Leave a note with your name, address, and vehicle registration number in a conspicuous place
Call the police only if the damage appears to exceed $500
Drive away; since it was parked, you are not obligated to do anything

questions.text: Leaving the scene of a crash involving injury or death is a criminal offense that can result in:
options: A small fine and points on your driving record
Mandatory attendance in a driver improvement course
Felony charges, mandatory license revocation, and severe penalties including imprisonment
A 30-day suspension of your driver's license

questions.text: Florida's No-Fault Law requires all motor vehicle owners to carry a minimum of:
options: $10,000 of Bodily Injury Liability (BIL) per person
$10,000 of Personal Injury Protection (PIP) and $10,000 of Property Damage Liability (PDL)
$25,000 of Uninsured Motorist (UM) coverage
Only comprehensive and collision coverage for their own vehicle

questions.text: To reinstate your driver license after a suspension for a No-Fault insurance violation, you typically must:
options: Wait for the suspension period to expire automatically
Provide proof of insurance and pay a reinstatement fee
Retake the driving skills test and vision test
Complete a state-approved defensive driving course

questions.text: If you are at fault in a crash and are not insured as required by the Financial Responsibility Law, you may:
options: Have your license and tags suspended for up to 3 years, or until you provide proof of insurance and pay restitution
Only be required to pay a small fine to the other driver's insurance company
Be forced to sell your vehicle to cover the damages
Have your insurance rates automatically increased for 5 years

questions.text: A holder of a learner's driver license is restricted to driving:
options: Only between 5 AM and 9 PM
Only during daylight hours for the first 3 months, and until 10 PM thereafter, with a licensed driver 21+ in the front seat
At any time, as long as a licensed adult is in the vehicle
Only to and from school or work

questions.text: For the first three months after licensing, a driver who is 17 years old:
options: Has no driving restrictions
May only drive between 6:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m., unless driving to or from work
May only drive during daylight hours, after 3 months they can drive until 10:00 p.m.
Is not allowed to drive on any interstate highways

questions.text: A driver who is under 18 years of age:
options: May not drive between the hours of 11:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m., unless driving to or from work or accompanied by a licensed driver 21+
Has the same driving privileges as any adult driver
May only drive during daylight hours for the first year
Is prohibited from having any passengers under the age of 25

questions.text: You can be charged with Driving Under the Influence (DUI) in Florida if you are driving or in actual physical control of a vehicle while:
options: Your blood alcohol level (BAC) is .08% or more, or you are impaired by alcohol, chemical substances, or controlled substances
You have consumed any amount of alcohol, regardless of impairment
You have a detectable amount of an illegal drug in your system, even if you are not impaired
You are under the age of 21 and have a BAC of .02% or more, but adults can only be charged at .08%

questions.text: Under Florida's Implied Consent Law, refusing to take a breath, blood, or urine test when lawfully requested by an officer:
options: Is your legal right and has no immediate consequences
Will result in an automatic 1-year license suspension for a first refusal
Will only result in a small fine if you are not ultimately convicted of DUI
Is only a penalty if you are subsequently convicted of DUI

questions.text: A conviction for racing on the highway will result in:
options: A mandatory 1-year revocation of your driver license
A small fine and 3 points on your driving record
A written warning for a first offense
Required attendance at a weekend driving seminar

questions.text: To be eligible for a Class E license, a holder of a learner's license must have logged at least ____ of supervised driving practice.
options: 30 hours, with 5 hours at night
40 hours, with 10 hours at night
50 hours, with 10 hours at night
60 hours, with 15 hours at night

questions.text: First-time applicants for a Florida learner's license must show proof of completion of:
options: A Basic Rider Course (for motorcycles)
A Traffic Law and Substance Abuse Education (TLSAE) course
A Advanced Driver Improvement (ADI) course
No formal course is required, only a written test

questions.text: Are you required to notify the FLHSMV of a medical condition that could affect your driving?
options: No, medical privacy laws prevent this requirement
Yes, you must report any permanent or long-term condition that could impair your driving ability
Only if the condition causes you to lose consciousness
Only after you have been involved in a crash caused by the condition

questions.text: A driver might choose to voluntarily take a Basic Driver Improvement (BDI) course to:
options: Fulfill a court order, avoid points on their license, or qualify for an insurance discount
Learn how to perform advanced maneuvers like evasive skid control
Replace the required TLSAE course for first-time license applicants
Reduce the number of practice hours needed for a learner's license

questions.text: The driving skills exam for a Class E license will typically include:
options: Only highway driving and merging at speed
A pre-trip vehicle inspection and a closed-course obstacle test
Basic maneuvers such as approaching intersections, backing, and parking
A night driving evaluation and a skid recovery test
